p: After determining that vsiRNA production can be triggered by infection of VSR-deficient DENV2 and be active, we examined whether RNAi exerts antiviral effect on DENV2 replication in infected human somatic cells. To this end, normal 293T and 293T-NoDice cells were infected with DENV2 WT or DENV2 K135A. Our results showed that the deficiency of VSR resulted in substantial attenuation of viral RNA accumulation and virion production of DENV2 K135A at 3 dpi in 293T cells ( Fig. 3, C and D). Concomitantly, abundant DENV2 vsiRNAs were produced in 293T cells infected with DENV2 K135A but not DENV2 WT ( Fig. 3A, lanes 2 and 3).
